===Turkish (Shaman & Islamic)===
 
===Turkish (Shaman & Islamic)===
    −
In Turkish the word "Love" comes up with several meanings. A person can love the god, a person,the parents or the family. But that person can "Love" just one person from the opposite sex which they call the word " Ask ".
+
In Turkish the word "Love" comes up with several meanings. A person can love the god, a person, the parents or the family. But that person can "Love" just one person from the opposite sex which they call the word " Ask ".
−
''[[Ask]]'' is a feeling for ''to love'', as it still is in Turkish today. The Turks used this word just for their romatic loves in a romantic or sexual sense. If a Turk says that he is in Love (Ask) with somebody, it is not a love that a person can feel for his or her parents. It is just for one person and it indicates a huge infatuation.
+
''[[Ishq|Ask]]'' is a feeling for ''to love'', as it still is in Turkish today. The Turks used this word just for their romatic loves in a romantic or sexual sense. If a Turk says that he is in Love (Ask) with somebody, it is not a love that a person can feel for his or her parents. It is just for one person and it indicates a huge infatuation.
−
